latex: Let $[n]$ denote the set of integers $\left\{ 1, 2, \ldots, n \right\}$. We randomly choose a function $f:[n] \to [n]$, out of the $n^n$ possible functions. We also choose an integer $a$ uniformly at random from $[n]$. Find the probability that there exist positive integers $b, c \geq 1$ such that $f^b(1) = a$ and $f^c(a) = 1$. ($f^k(x)$ denotes the result of applying $f$ to $x$ $k$ times.)
